titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ida Grady scrapbook, 1927-1930 UA.30.01.0066
titlestmt.author: Josh Larkin Rowley

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-07 21:11:18 UTC.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Ida Grady scrapbook
did.abstract: Nancy Ida Grady, a native of Asheville, N.C., graduated from Duke University's Woman's College in 1928. Scrapbook contains photographs, postcards, calling cards, invitations, programs, poems, and other memorabilia. Among the programs are several from church services in Durham and Asheville, theatre productions including performances by the Taurian Players and the YWCA, and several guest lectures at Duke. Also present are exams, quizzes, and study questions from courses at Duke in Bible study, religions of China and Japan, Egypt and Mesopotamia.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research.
Nitrate negatives are closed to use; access copies are available on request.
Please contact the Rubenstein Library before coming to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ida Grady Scrapbook, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Ida Grady scrapbook was received by the University Archives as a gift in 2008.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Joshua Larkin Rowley, April 2009
Encoded by Joshua Larkin Rowley, April 2009
Accession UA2008-0070 is described in this finding aid.
Original cellulose nitrate negatives were removed, rehoused, and described by Tracy M. Jackson, July 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Nancy Ida Grady was from Asheville, N.C. and a 1928 graduate of the Woman's College at Duke University. While at Duke, Grady was Secretary-Treasurer of the Young Women's Christian Association (YWCA), a member of the Historical Society, and Vice-President of the League of Women Voters.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook contains photographs, postcards, calling cards, invitations, programs, poems, and other assorted ephemera and memorabilia. Among the programs are several from church services in Durham and Asheville, theatre productions including performances by the Taurian Players and the YWCA, and several guest lectures at Duke. Also present are exams, quizzes, and study questions from courses at Duke in Bible study, religions of China and Japan, Egypt and Mesopotamia.

The scrapbook has been disassembled and foldered for preservation purposes. Detached clippings and assorted ephemera are housed in envelopes. Nitrate negatives are closed to use; digital scans are available with advance request.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folders contain thirty (30) cellulose nitrate negatives from the Ida Grady scrapbook; descriptions were created by library staff.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Nitrate negatives are closed to use; copies are available on request. Please contact Rubenstein Library Research Services for assistance.
